title: honor system

replies.body: Honour from friends counts for almost nothing - you're better off honouring and getting honoured from randoms anyway.

> [{quoted}](name=Aneirin,realm=OCE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EH1nGEnY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-16T21:53:28.313+0000)
>
> Honour from friends counts for almost nothing - you're better off honouring and getting honoured from randoms anyway.

You sure about that?

"Can I game the system and boost to level 5 by constantly playing with a premade and honoring each other every game?

Nice idea. We had it too. So we specifically built Honor so potential exploits like this give you (and your friend) literally no benefit."

I mean... pretty sure? They built it with less benefit from premade honors vs random honors to avoid folks gaming the system.

But hey, if it's different let us know!

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008474148-Honor-FAQ

Well but it still doesn't say honor from your premades are almost worthless just that you won't honor faster if you spam honors to each other with your premade. I have two friends who play reaaaally often. Both of them are around lvl 165 already but one of them always plays in 5men premade (so he is only honored from premades) while the other mostly plays alone (so he is honored from strangers mostly). Both of them reached the honor level 5 the same day.

So it's not like honors from your premade won't help you, it just doesn't make you level 5 faster if you are honored from your 4 premades every game.

I think the idea is to prevent gaming the system. So coming up with ways to “funnel” honor onto one person shouldn’t be as affective as legitimately getting honor, be it from your premades or from random teammates.

I would say it isn't as effective but it definitely doesn't count for almost nothing. It just looks like that getting honored every single game by your premade gets you to higher honor levels as fast as getting honored by strangers from time to time assuming the amount of games played is almost the same and both persons have no valid reports.
I definitely agree with the no valid reports. I don’t really play with premades often so I don’t know for sure.
This is not the kind of answer an employee of any service should be giving. It's snarky and rude. If you know different, then provide the correct information.

Text is notorious for not denoting emotional or tonal context. Unfortunately the alternative is to write something like "have you checked in on that? I cant confirm the numbers behind it, but i'd encourage you take a look at that and your experience to confirm because I believe that answer is wrong no offense.". While I certainly can write like that, for me it feels really stiff and lifeless. It feels safe :(. I'd rather be genuine and honest and run the small risk of being read incorrectly than sacrifice all empathy in my communication style to be politically correct. However, thats just me :) sorry if I came off in the wrong way.

I wasn't offended if that's any comfort. The problem with boards is it can be a bit of an echo chamber - I can see a few people say something and assume it's fact without researching it myself, so I've no problem with being called out on it if I'm providing incorrect information.
